title:
Misclassification excess risk bounds for PAC-Bayesian classification via
  convexified loss
abstract:
PAC-Bayesian bounds have proven to be a valuable tool for deriving
generalization bounds and for designing new learning algorithms in machine
learning. However, it typically focus on providing generalization bounds with
respect to a chosen loss function. In classification tasks, due to the
non-convex nature of the 0-1 loss, a convex surrogate loss is often used, and
thus current PAC-Bayesian bounds are primarily specified for this convex
surrogate. This work shifts its focus to providing misclassification excess
risk bounds for PAC-Bayesian classification when using a convex surrogate loss.
Our key ingredient here is to leverage PAC-Bayesian relative bounds in
expectation rather than relying on PAC-Bayesian bounds in probability. We
demonstrate our approach in several important applications.
